alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Greeley; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 8:49PM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT TO MIDNIGHT CST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations mainly 6 to 10 inches. Isolated higher amounts to around 12 inches possible. Winds will average 15 to 20 MPH with gusts to around 30 MPH, initially out of the northeast but then turning northwesterly Wednesday night. * WHERE...Valley, Greeley, Sherman and Dawson Counties. * WHEN...From midnight Tuesday night to midnight CST Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow and occasionally heavy snow rates could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions likely impact both the morning and evening commute times on Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While minor forecast adjustments remain possible, forecast confidence has increased enough that significant snow accumulation will indeed occur.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
